P40STGBS.question: How interested are you in politics?

P10STGBS.description: Attitudes toward democracy and alternative regimes
P10STGBS.question: What is your general attitude toward democracy compared to other forms of government?

values.1: Democracy is preferable to any other kind of government
values.2: Under some circumstances, an authoritarian government can be preferable to a democratic one
values.3: For people like me, it doesn’t matter whether we have a democratic or non-democratic regime

P18ST.A.description: Attitude toward democracy despite its problems
P18ST.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy may have problems but it is the best system of government?

P18STM.B.description: Acceptance of undemocratic government if it solves problems
P18STM.B.question: Do you agree or disagree that an undemocratic government is acceptable if it can solve the country's problems?

P18STM.C.description: Acceptance of media control by the president in times of difficulty
P18STM.C.question: Do you agree or disagree that in difficult times, it is acceptable for the president to control the media?

P18N.D.description: Support for diversity of media sources in democracy
P18N.D.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy requires a diversity of sources in the media?

P18N.E.question: Do you agree or disagree that the judiciary must be independent from the executive power?

P18N.F.question: Do you agree or disagree that political parties in your country work well?

P18N.G.description: Skepticism about hard-handed governments solving problems
P18N.G.question: Do you agree or disagree that even a hard-handed government would not be able to solve the country’s problems?

P16ST.question: In politics, people often talk about 'left' and 'right'. Where would you place yourself on this scale?

P18ST.I.description: Belief in democracy's ability to solve problems
P18ST.I.question: Do you agree or disagree that democracy makes it possible to solve the problems the country faces?

P19N.question: Do you agree or disagree that society should be open to a diversity of traditions and habits?

values.1: Disagree — society should defend its own traditions and habits
values.2: Agree — society should be open to a diversity of traditions and habits

P20STM.description: Support for military government in difficult times
P20STM.question: Would you support a military government replacing the democratic government if the situation becomes very difficult?

values.1: Yes, I would support a military government
values.2: No, I would not support a military government under any circumstance

P21ST.description: Role of political parties in democracy
P21ST.question: Do you believe that democracy can function without political parties?

values.1: No — democracy cannot function without political parties
values.2: Yes — democracy can work without parties

P22ST.question: To what extent do you think it is justifiable or unjustifiable to evade paying taxes?

P34WVSNA.question: Which of the following do you think is the most important priority for the country?

values.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

P34WVSNB.question: Which of the following do you think is the second most important priority for the country?

values.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

P35NA.description: Most important principle for good governance
P35NA.question: Which of the following do you think is most important for the best way to govern a country?

values.1: Concentrating political power in one leader
values.3: Ensuring the media does not question those in power

P35NB.description: Second most important principle for good governance
P35NB.question: Which of the following do you think is second most important for the best way to govern a country?

values.1: Concentrating political power in one leader
values.3: Ensuring the media does not question those in power

P46N.description: Views on freedom of expression vs. fake news control
P46N.question: Do you think it is more important to protect freedom of expression even if it allows fake news, or to control fake news even if it limits freedom of expression?

values.1: Freedom of expression should be guaranteed, even if it means fake news circulates
values.2: Fake news should be controlled, even if it limits freedom of expression

P54N.A.question: Do you agree or disagree that protests are a legitimate way to express political demands?
